abstract.text: A view controller that specializes in managing a table view.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: when your interface consists of a table view and little or no other content. Table view controllers already adopt the protocols you need to manage your table view’s content and respond to changes. In addition,
Automatically loads the table view archived in a storyboard or nib file, which you can access using the
Sets the data source and the delegate of the table view to

method, automatically reloads the data for its table view on first appearance, and clears its selection (with or without animation, depending on the request) every time the table view appears (disable this last behavior by changing the value of
method and automatically flashes the table view’s scroll indicators when it first appears
method and automatically toggles the edit mode of the table when the user taps an Edit|Done button in the navigation bar
Automatically resizes its table view to accommodate the appearance or disappearance of the onscreen keyboard

for each table view that you manage. When you initialize the table view controller, you must specify the style of the table view (plain or grouped). You must also override the data source and delegate methods required to fill your table with data. You may override
or any other superclass method, but if you do, be sure to invoke the superclass implementation of the method, usually as the first method call.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS, iPadOS, or tvOS app.
An interface that provides a source for shareable content to fulfill user requests to share current content.
A collection of methods that gives you access to the appearance proxy for a class.
A protocol that a class must adopt to allow appearance customization using the
API.
A view controller that specializes in managing a collection view.
A set of methods for adapting the contents of your view controllers to size and trait changes.
A set of methods that define the focus behavior for a branch of the view hierarchy.
The interface that determines whether a responder object supports paste configuration.
A set of standard methods that apps can adopt to support editing.
The interface for the delegate of a scroll view.
Methods for adding objects to your state restoration archives.
A view controller that specializes in managing a table view.
A Boolean value indicating if the controller clears the selection when the table appears.
Creates a table view controller from data in an unarchiver.
Creates a table view controller with the nib file in the specified bundle.
Initializes a table view controller to manage a table view of a given style.
The refresh control used to update the table contents.
Returns the table view managed by the controller object.
The methods that an object adopts to manage data and provide cells for a table view.
Methods for managing selections, configuring section headers and footers, deleting and reordering cells, and performing other actions in a table view.
A type that calls your code in reaction to changes in the trait environment.
A set of methods that makes the iOS interface environment available to your app.
The protocol you adopt to restore an object’s state from a user activity.
An object that manages a view hierarchy for your UIKit app.
Creates the view that the controller manages.
Sets whether the view controller shows an editable view.
Notifies the view controller that its view was added to a view hierarchy.
Notifies the view controller that its view is about to be added to a view hierarchy.
Build a view controller in storyboards, configure it with custom views, and fill those views with your app’s data.

doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKi.title: Displaying and managing views with a view controller

abstract.text: Create and configure cells for your table dynamically using a data source object, or provide them statically from your storyboard.
Detect when a user taps a table view cell so your app can take the next indicated action.

doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKi.title: Handling row selection in a table view

abstract.text: Display view controllers using different techniques, and pass data between them during transitions.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
The interface an app extension uses to respond to a request from a host app.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that an object adopts to create a bar object in your app.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
